transcript.text: hello to all, very happy to see you again, I would like to tell you a little story and
above all to tell you about a job that still needs to be done, it is tireless work to be able to ensure
that the European Parliament is not used by interests that seek
to use it to advance their ideological agenda, in particular an Islamist agenda,
I received a message in the Parliament's internal mailbox a few days ago announcing the
week for the fight against racism and for diversity which will take place in a few weeks
from next March 20, no possibility of opposing an agenda that seems
so virtuous, but I was surprised to see, looking more closely on the poster for this
event, that one of the main funders is a well-known association called ENAR
(European network against racism) this association which had long been led by a director who
admitted to having been a member of the Muslim Brotherhood is  an organisation well known indeed to the
European institutions since it has received just that 7 and a half million euros from the
European Commission since 2007 in the name of its fight against racism but when we look at
who constitutes this platform of European associations when we look at the way
it introduces itself, we have reason to worry about the reality of its action. On October 19, 2020
it was exactly three days after Samuel Paty was assassinated the ENAR association published
a press release which supported the Collective against Islamophobia in France – the CCIF had indeed
been targeted by a measure of dissolution by the French government a measure of dissolution
which aimed to put an end to the activity of a collective which was fighting for example against
the expulsion of imams who preach hatred on the grounds that it was anti-Muslim acts the
CCIF was praised by ENAR for carrying out, I quote, "important research to
uncover the reality of anti-Muslim racism usulman in France" you see there the extraordinary shift
in the wording "anti-Muslim racism"... : Islam to our knowledge is a religion
it is not a race and criticizing Islamism is in no way a form of racism. It is precisely behind
this screen that the rhetoric of the Muslim Brotherhood is traditionally hidden
ENAR concluded that the dissolution of the CCIF was indeed the proof of, I quote, "structural racism
targeting civilians which characterizes France". France is indeed one of the permanent victims
of ENAR's attacks which, for example, very radically challenged the Loi "Séparatismes" or
which strongly attacked the criticisms we had addressed to the FEMYSO association, you
remember this association which promotes in particular the wearing of muslim veil and it was with FEMYSO
that these European Commission advertising campaigns were designed, which said that it
was necessary "to bring joy, accept the hijab". To criticize FEMYSO would be racist, criticize
those who promote the veil... but then what will we answer – once again I keep
repeating it – what will we answer to the Iranian women who even today as
we speak are still victims of terrible repression on the part of of the Iranian regime
for their desire for freedom and the expression of this desire in independence with regard to the
Islamist norms which today weigh on them? The press release which criticized my reproaches with regard
to FEMYSO was signed this time by a whole panoply of associations which are part of
ENAR, for example Alliance Citoyenne which is, as you may know, the association which campaigns
for the burkini in the swimming pools of Grenoble or the CCIE which, what a magical turn of events, is a
resuscitated form in Brussels pf the CCIF in France, this time as Committee against Islamophobia in Europe.
Once you have been dissolved in Paris, you can reconstitute yourself elsewhere... Or even
the organisation which is called CAGE which is a British association which had taken
the defense of the executioner of Daesh, a British citizen who had committed unspeakable acts
with the organization of the Islamic State, which had notably beheaded civilians and which explained –
the CAGE association – that the radicalization of this executioner of Daesh was in reality the fault of
British policy itself and yes in the countries Muslims and also the fault of these, I quote,
"domestic policies that suffocate British Muslim citizens". So
you see that the pedigree of this ENAR association seems rather to disqualify it from talking about the
fight against racism and diversity and whether it likes it or not we are now going to
engage in all the battle necessary to ensure that this desire to continue to irrigate
our institutions in a roundabout way finally stops definitively. We want to defend our
model of society, we want to defend our democracies, we want to defend our
civilization, we want to defend our sense of diversity and pluralism, and we do not want
this stifling agenda, really stifling, that one would like to impose on us behind the
kind intentions displayed. This is why we are obviously going – first within
our political group, that we must start by alerting, then within Parliament – to ensure that all
complicity with this platform finally ceases forever. Thank you very much, and see you very soon.
